title: russia new missiles arms race
story: Yury Solomonov, chief designer at the Moscow Institute of Thermal Technology , said America is now playing catch up in an arms race it will struggle to win.He said: “They will not be able to catch up quickly with the ideas that we have already implemented, although it is not dficult in the modern world to implement them and start production.”“This does not mean that they will not be able to do the same. Butthey start doing it now, they will be able to catch up in  to  years.”The Kremlin-backed MITT is the designer of Russia’s Yars, Topol and Bulava intercontinental ballistic missiles .Solomonovs claims come as Russia deploys its new generation S- Vityaz defence system and days after warning its hypersonic missiles will render US defences useless.Solomonov said although Americas nuclear arsenal remains very powerful, it is still using Minuteman ICBMs created in the s.In the meantime, Vladimir Putins military has created a new generation of land and sea-based strategic nuclear systems, he added.They include the Sarmat RS- is ballistic missile - a -tonne missile could destroy an area the size of Texas or France.Speaking about the US ballistic missile defence system being deployed in Alaska and Europe, Solomonov said that Russia should not be afraid as its “efficiency is extremely low.”Just last week Putin boasted about the superiority of Russias new weapons as he promised to boost its nuclear arsenalthe US pulls out of a Cold War arms treaty.The Russian president specically mentioned the new Kinzhal hypersonic missile and the Avangard hypersonic glide vehicle, which he said have no foreign equivalents.Speaking at a meeting with the top military brass in Moscow he said such weapons will help ensure the countrys security for decades to come.Kinzhal has already been commissioned by the military and aircraft carrying the missiles have flown  patrol missions this year.The high-speed Kinzhal - or Dagger - has been described by the Russian strongman an ideal weapon and can fly at almost ,mph across , miles to hit precise targets.The hypersonic intercontinental rocket is capable of travelling  times the speed of sound and can strike like a meteorite, like a fireball, Putin has said.No one has hypersonic weapons yet, but we have it, Putin told the assembled military officers.He later fired his new hypersonic ballistic missile in a final test before the invincible nukes enter service next year, according to reports.The president was in the control room as the Avangard weapon was launched at a dummy target thousands of miles away in Siberia, the Kremlin said.It comes weeks Russias defence chiefs said the missiles will be ready for deployment in , a year ahead of forecasts.US intelligence analysts have warned the West has no defence against the nukes, which can hit anywhere in the world, reports claimed earlier this year.Avangard is a believed to be a high-tech hypersonic glide vehicle which is mounted on board an SS- intercontinental ballistic missile.Once launched from the rocket at high altitude, it is designed to use aerodynamic forces to sail on top of the atmosphere at more than five times the speed of sound.It could carry a warhead, experts say, but even without explosives its sheer speed - more than a mile a second - gives it the force to obliterate any target.And it thought to be highly manoeuvrable and equipped with electronic countermeasures that can defeat the most sophisticated missile tracking systems.Thomas Karako, director of the Missile Defence Project at the Centre for Strategic and International Studies, told CNBC: These kinds of boost glide vehicles attack the gaps in our missile defence system.He added it was unfortunate that we have let Russia come this far.And Air Force General John Hyten, commander of US Strategic Command, has told the Senate Armed Services Committee: Both Russia and China are aggressively pursuing hypersonic capabilities.We dont have any defence that could deny the employment of such a weapon against us.Earlier this month state news agency Tass reported a senior commander saying the first Avangard weapons will be deployed in .Colonel-General Sergei Karakayev said: First complexes are planned to be put on combat duty at the missile regiment of the Dombarosky ision starting next year.Last week, the Russian navy began sea trials of a nuclear drone that experts fear could trigger radioactive tsunamis.

title: arron hough cruise ship image family
story: As family pay tribute to their “superstar” relative, his sister, Emilie, has changed her Facebook cover photo to show her beloved brother dancing.Arron, , from Sunderland, was last seen on Christmas Day aboard the Harmony of the Seas – the second biggest liner on the planet – some  miles off Puerto Rico.It is still not known what happened to the young Brit who was spotted on CCTV at around am on Tuesday entering Deck  of the ship.Hundreds of messages of support have been posted on Emilie’s Facebook page, with friends calling him truly special.And a relative, Rebecca Hough, praised Arron as the family’s “superstar” next to video footage of him performing on stage.The Sunderland community has also spoken of the entertainer’s talent and beautul soul.Residents have paid tribute to his “lovely” personality by posting messages of support for his family and friends on the Sunderland Echo’s Facebook page.Relative Michelle Loughlin said: “My cousin so so sad family are devestated [sic].Alison Mackintosh posted: “Thinking of Arron’s family at this time, so so very sorry, heartbreaking to say the least.You don’t expect anything like this to happen - tragic events on board what should have been a magical time for all.”Judith Beth Carney added: “So tragic – a very talented young man.”A GoFundMe page set up to help his family at this dficult time has so far raised more than £,.Among those contributing is Courtney Watkinson, who said that she had followed the “path of Arron attending a professional dance college.“I know how hard he has worked and how tough this industry can be, but Arron is and always be inspirational to all those within the industry.”There has been mystery surrounding the British entertainers disappearance as an expert claimed it is “extremely dficult” to accidentally fall overboard on modern cruise ships.Adam Coulter, UK Managing Editor of Cruise Critic, said the rules and safety features on big cruise liners mean it is unlikely that the -year-old fell  overboard accidentally.He told The Sun Online: “It is extremely dficult to fall overboard a large, well-designed cruise ship such as Harmony of the Seas.“All cruise ships have to adhere to exceptionally strict international rules and regulations with regards onboard safety, and cruise lines continue to capitalise on the latest technologies to ensure these regulations are met effectively.“Thanks to such strict rules, and a host of innovative design features regarding high railings and balcony heights, cruise ships are an incredibly safe form of travel.“We can’t recall any cases in recent memory where someone accidentally fell overboard, without an underlying cause.”The US Coast Guard has announced that it has suspended the search for the dancer and singer.In the week before he fell overboard, Arron posted a series of dark and cryptic messages online which were in sharp contrast to his usual posts showing him having fun with pals on board the giant ship.A week before he vanished, the -year-old tweeted: “Social media is the killer of people.”He also posted a message which complained of “the fake lives we live on social media.”The post added: “…pretending to all of our followers that were having such an amazing crazy ride when actually were not.“We struggle, we have hard times but we hide this with happy pictures we post ...“…which is fine to keep sadness but sometimes you gotta embrace the facts that youre feeling down and youre feeling alone.“But dont think this is a bad thing, to embrace the positives you also have to acknowledge the negatives.”He also wrote: Gonna kill someone f***ing hell among a series of positive messages.In a tweet on December , he posted a cryptic message which read: Beneath the water is beauty. Always look beneath the surface before you decide on things.Arron, a cast member in the musical Grease onboard, trained as a dancer and singer at the Urdang Academy theatre school in London.The alarm on the ship was raised when Arron didnt show up for work on Tuesday.Once authorities had been alerted, the Harmony of the Seas was many miles away on its voyage towards the island of St Maarten.Suspending the search at .pm today, Commander Christopher Douglas, chief of response for Coast Guard Sector San Juan, expressed his sympathy for the Brits loved ones.He said: Weve been in contact with members of Mr Houghs family throughout our search efforts and know this is a very dficult and painful time for them.“Suspending a search is one of the most dficult decisions we have to make as first responders, and it is never made lightly.The Coast Guard was alerted to Houghs disappearance at .pm on Christmas Day - almost  hours after Hough was last seen on CCTV at around am entering Deck  of the ship.It scrambled a ship and an HC- Hercules plane from Florida to look for him.Crews searched for  hours by plane and boat and covered , square miles.Royal Caribbean said it conducted a ship-wide search when Arron failed to report for work.Staff used CCTV to trace his last movements on Deck , which houses the theatre and a number of bars and restaurants.The cruise firm said in a statement: We are saddened to report that after a review of the ships closed-circuit camera footage, he was observed entering an area on Deck  at around am and was not seen again.Local authorities were notied and a ship-wide search for the crew member was conducted.A former theatre school classmate of Arron told The Sun Online: Its a complete shock. I spoke to him before Christmas.He was fine to me, he was a really really happy guy. He had no problems that I knew of.“He was talented, outgoing and young. He just wanted to be a performer.The Urdang Academy tweeted: We are all praying for @Arronhoughxox and his family.Please keep up your hope and faith that he is found safe and sound as soon as possible.”The cruise company says its care team is providing support to his family, adding its thoughts and prayers are with them during this dficult time.A friend of Arron said she was “heartbroken beyond words” at the news.She said: “Arron is the type of person people can only wish to have in their lives.“He lights up any room like no one  can and everyone who knows and loves him has so many happy and cherished memories.“His infectious laugh and beaming smile is enough to pull anyone out from feeling down in the dumps.“I hope and pray we get our Arron back home where he belongs, the light of our lives has gone out.Others shared their thoughts and prayers for Arron online.Fellow singer and actor Andy Rose said: Always have and always will be a family at the Urdang Academy #PrayForArron.Kathryn-Anne Rivers said: So heart breaking! Praying for Arron and for everyone Urdang Academy and especially Arrons family that your boy is brought home!Such an incredible young man!Royal Caribbean said Harmony of the Seas is currently sailing on a seven-night Christmas cruise that departed from Fort Lauderdale, Florida, on Sunday.The ships first port of call was Philipsburg, on St Maarten, before stops in San Juan, Puerto Rico, and Labadee, Haiti.

title: free health check spot dementia
story: Only half of the  million people eligible have taken the  minute test, according to NHS England.The test also screens for heart problems, kidney disease and type  diabetes.Dementia and Alzheimers disease remained the leading cause of death in England and Wales in , accounting for nearly  per cent of all registered deaths, according to the Office for National Statistics.Someone who has had a stroke, or has diabetes or heart disease, is around twice as likely to develop vascular dementia, according to the Alzheimers Society.The start of a new year is exactly the right time to commit to taking a simple, free and potentially le-saving step towards a healthier le, said Alistair Burns, national clinical director for dementia at NHS England.Everyone aged between  and  with no pre-existing health conditions is automatically eligible for the check, which happens every five years.It is part of the NHS in Englands goal of improving early diagnosis of dementia.Laura Phipps, head of communications at Alzheimers Research UK, said: There is good evidence to suggest that whats good for the heart is also good for the brain, but while  per cent people believe they can reduce their risk of heart disease, only  per cent of people know they can reduce their risk of dementia.Research shows that midle is a crucial time to take action that will help maintain a healthy brain into later le. With dementia now the UKs leading cause of death, we must encourage everyone to take positive steps to maintain good brain health throughout le and into older age.Jamie Waterall, who leads on the programme at Public Health England, said: The NHS health check looks at the top causes of premature death and ill health but more importantly supports people to take action of reducing their risk of preventable conditions such as dementia and heart disease.The national target of ensuring at least two-thirds of people living with dementia are diagnosed and treated has been met for the past two years, NHS England said.Information about the health check can be found on the NHS UK website.

title: mummified alien found egyptian tomb

title: country mansion maze south wales
story: The six-bedroom country retreat is home to a giant octagonal maze in its stunning grounds.Owners built the unusual feature using , yew trees and it takes around ten minutes to complete.Puzzle-solvers who get to the middle are met by another puzzle - a monkey puzzle tree which is an evergreen tree native to Chile.The unnamed owner said: We designed the maze from scratch, actually using an excel spreadsheet to draw it out.It is designed on an octagonal base  metres across with eight concentric rows of hedge.To begin with it had to be well watered and we also laid weed suppressant material along each stretch of trees as they were growing and have subsequently laid grit on the paths to keep the weeds at bay.The gardens have been professionally landscaped to also include a rose garden, an ornamental pond and a croquet lawn.The house, called Waterspring, looks out over the countryside near Chepstow, Monmouthshire.Its owners redeveloped the property in  to make it into a stunning country home.Behind the solid oak front door is a grand staircase and Italian marble flooring with underfloor heating.There is access to a study and a formal dining room to the front of the property.The spacious drawing room has a feature fireplace with a Derbyshire stone surround and mantle.On the first floor is a master suite with a walk-in wardrobe and ensuite bathroom.There are also five further bedrooms - four which have an ensuite.On the second floor is a games room with space for a table tennis table and pool table.The house also has five acres of land including paddocks.

title: boy swallows magnets amazon colon removed
story: Jenner White, a mum from Wisconsin, posted on Facebook that her four-year-old son, Beck, had swallowed “ tiny magnets” after breaking open what appeared to be a Magformers tile toy.After taking her son to Childrens Hospital in Milwaukee she posted on Facebook: “He has finished with surgery they had to remove part of his colon, intestines and appendix.“The magnets created holes and infection in his intestines.”When Jenner first noticed her son was ill, she thought he had caught the flu, according to WTMJ, but that changed drastically.She added: “He started to vomit a very dark colour. It looked like coffee grounds.“At that point I knew something was very wrong.”After she and her husband, Jeremy, transported Beck to the hospital, X-rays showed the boy had eaten the magnets inside his toy, and they had started tearing holes in his intestines.The holes led to an infection and Beck continues to be monitored for infection.There is no word on any long-term issues that he may face after he recovers from this episode.Jenner told WHNT: “The mom guilt is huge because you feel that you failed your child.”Beck is autistic, and typically White says she takes great precaution with his toys.“I dont want another mother or father to go through this. It was such a simple toy,” Jenner added.The American Academy of Pediatricsalso has been warning the public about the dangers of magnetic childrens toys.Former AAP President Fernando Stein in a statement last year: “High-powered magnets have caused unnecessary surgeries, debilitating injuries, irreversible gastrointestinal damage and other lelong health impacts in infants, children and adolescents.“Paediatricians have been ringing an alarm bell about these dangerous magnets since we first recognised the damage they cause, and we urge parents to avoid purchasing them as gts for children during the holiday season.”In a Facebook update, Jenner stated that Amazon took down the magnetic toy product from their site after her story has gone viral.“Amazon has removed the products that were gted to us,” she wrote.“This is a huge win in my book because as you can see it in the original product purchasing it says it age appropriate for babys SMDH.”

title: karren brady vote 2018 mega year women
story: I don’t know about you but I can’t even pretend I’m going to be sad to see the back of .In fact, it’s fair to say it was pretty much an annus ­horribilis.We have spent the year ­watching the country unravel in a slow, disastrous free-fall, unable to work out how the heck we are going to achieve anything even remotely ­resembling a “good” Brexit.And it’s still not clear.The reality is that we can all speculateuntil the cows come home.Sure, it might be a bit like the Millennium Bug in , when people were ­certain we would go into techno-meltdown on the stroke of midnight, only to wake up to a world that was exactly the same.Then again, there might be dficulties in post-Brexit Britain that haven’t even ­occurred to us yet.The truth is, we don’t know what le is going to be like after About time too. But still, it’s progress.And there is no doubt that ­attitudes to women are changing.We’ve got a second female Prime ­Minister and a female playing the lead in Doctor Who.And women are rising up. We are organising, ­protesting, shaming and building power.We are making the women’s movement central to everyone’s conversation. Women are finding their voice.And the most important thing is we are getting heard.We are not going to accept mansplaining or being ­spoken down to “stupid woman”.Feminism is the word of the year, with more and more women standing up for themselves and demanding equality, and I predict that process is going to continue in .Now that I think about it, there were other good things about .It was the year we rediscovered hope in football during the World Cup.We did better than we thought we would — and it’s not often we can say that.The England team and manager Gareth Southgate restored our ­national self-esteem and gave us something to cheer about when there really was not much .The World Cup showed us nice guys can win.Sure, we didn’t bring home the trophy but it’s fair to say Gareth Southgate’s a winner in everyone’s eyes.And it’s not over yet:  is the women’s football World Cup — so that’s something to look forward to with hope.Hope is an important word. And now, more than ever, we need to find a way to hang on to the things that make us feel optimistic about the future.There were other hopeful things about .This was the year that gave us the breath of fresh air that is Meghan Markle — and it also saw the most stylish royal wedding this country has probably ever seen.Meghan was a signier of change for the Royal Family, which needed to modernise.And while I know some people have decided she is “pushy”, or criticise her for her relationship with her father, I think Meghan is one of the best things that has ever happened to our royals.We also had a royal baby — Prince Louis — and now we have another one on the way, which is happy news.My personal highlight of  was having lunch at Buckingham Palace with the Queen.It really was a wonderful occasion, spending intimate time talking to such an inspiring woman.And now here we are, poised on the brink of .I’m not a New Year’s Eve ­person. title: 3 new laws 2019 come
story: News new laws for  that come into force TOMORROWAs we ring in New Years Day, here are three resolutions the UK will have to keep - and how theyll hit youShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsPlenty of changes will come in  - here are three due on New Years Day "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailBritain is ringing in the new year with resolutions and pledges for . But while your gym pass and healthy food might be history by February, these are three resolutions youll have to keep.  brings a string of legal changes to everything from income tax to pensions to benefits to drones and MOTs. Many of these changes will only happen in April , which marks the new tax year. But an important few kick in on New Years Day itself. Heres a quick guide.   Energy giants will finally be banned from charging you more than a set amount from January . The cap - introduced by Theresa May after a long campaign marked by fudges and climbdowns - is set to help the million families on a default tarf. Default tarfs are the ones you end up onyou choose not to switch, ora fixed-term tarfs comes to an end and you dont pick a new one. Ofgem set the cap in November at pound, a year for a typical dual fuel customer who is paying by direct debit. That will save typical customers on default tarfs an average of pound a year, rising to pound for those whove been getting the worst deal. This cap is NOT the same as a freeze on prices. The cap can still rise to keep up with inflation and market forces.   From January , UK listed firms with more than  firms will have to start recording the ratio between their highest-paid and average-salary employees. It meansyoure middle-ranking at a software giant or a football club, youll know how many more times your salary the chief executive is making. Its all in good time for Fat Cat Friday, January , when FTSE  bosses will have already earned a typical workers wage for the whole of . Except its not, because January  is only the day the pay gaps start being recorded. They will only be actually published in . The way of measuring ratios has also come under fire, because it doesnt look at the lowest-paid staff, such as cleaners. Low-paid staff are also sometimes outsourced, leading to fears they could be left out of the figures.   EU rules on fishing are coming into effect on New Years Day - and a watchdog has warned they could have a devastating impact on the UKindustry. The landing obligation forces boats to bring fish caught beyond their quotas to shore, instead of throwing them back into the sea. After a four-year phasing-in period, it comes into effect in full on January . The aim is to conserve fish stocks by encouraging fishermen to be more selective about what they catch. But the law has been branded badly designed by UK fishermen because it could clog up busy harbours with extra beauracracy. The House of Lords EU Energy and Environment Sub-committee heard evidence that the rule could mean fishermen hitting their annualquotas much earlier in the year, with an estimated pound million worth of fish remaining uncaught in  as a result. And put this in your diary for January ... Rail fares are being hiked - but youll get a millennial railcard   Millions of commuters will have a big headache on their first day back at work as rail fares are hiked by an average of .%. It will send the cost of season tickets soaring yet again, and other unregulated fares could rise even higher. But at least theres a glimmer of good news youre aged  to . Until the day before your st birthday, you can apply for a so-called Millennial Railcard saving you a third on off-peak fares. The same discount applies to most peak fares but onlythey cost more than a pound minimum. The railcard was long delayed after spats between the rail industry and the Tory government, whove broken their pledge to launch it in  - by two days.

The Labour leaders  and  messages are similar in many ways. In both he pledges to stand up for the majority and unite the country against a privileged elite. But theres one big dference. Last time he didnt mention Brexit once. Now its front and centre of his address - an echo of just how much its come to dominate politics in the UK.  Theres a more subtle, but maybe more important, dference too - his tone. In his  message, Jeremy Corbyn was still floating on a better-than-expected performance in the general election. The message was of hope - promising the establishment had been weakened and a Labour government was closer than ever before. But with Theresa May trying to cling on almost until , and surviving a no confidence vote, those phrases are missing from this years address.  Instead the tone is more one of despair at the deadlock thats gripped the country over Brexit in the last  months, adding: We cannot go on like this. So how much do you think the message has changed  Weve put both new year messages side by side so you can think for yourself. Jeremy Corbyns  New Year messageI’d like to wish you all a Happy New Year. Ours is a fantastic country full of wonderful, caring and talented people with the hope of a great future ahead of us, where we all share in the wealth we create. But we are being held back by a self-serving elite, who look after themselves and their friends and a failed system which delivers staggering wealth at the top, while more and more people struggle to simply make ends meet. In  we said: no more. There is an alternative and millions joined our cause in the General Election. And now the establishment’s secret is out: they’re not as strong as they appear. Let’s face it, they have no idea how to fix their broken system or upgrade our stagnant economy. In , Labour’s mission is to give our people support and security and use their talents, unleash their creativity and fulfil their hopes. The old political consensus is finished. We are staking out the new centre ground in British politics, backing the things which most people want but are blocked by vested interests. We are a government in waiting, while the Conservatives are weak and ided and stuck in an outdated rut with no new ideas. The hope of a new Britain, run in the interests of the many, not the few, is closer than ever before.Together we can, and we will, deliver it. Jeremy Corbyns  New Year message I’d like to wish everyone a very Happy New Year. There’s so much talent across Britain but we’re being held back by a system that for far too long has only served a privileged few. And now the Conservatives have plunged the country into crisis over the complete mess theyve made of Brexit, trying to drive through a bad deal and letting people down all across the country whether they voted leave or remain. Eight years of damaging Tory failure has left us with a ided country where millions are struggling to make ends meet, where so many can’t afford a home to call their own, where older people are deprived of the dignity they deserve and far too many are working in low paid and insecure jobs. We cannot go on like this. Labour is ready to deliver a radical alternative to rebuild and transform our country. Well stand up to the powerful few so that the wealth you create is shared fairly not hoarded by a privileged elite. We’ll work to create a society where the talent of everyone is unleashed. That’s how we’ll unite our country. In , lets rebuild Britain for the many, not the few.

Strengthening our economy and opening up new markets for our businesses to create new jobs and opportunities across the UK building the houses our country needs so everyone can have a home of their own and transforming technical education so everyone gains the skills they need to get on.Our long term plan for the NHS will put a record investment into our most precious public service so it is there for us when we need it.We will introduce a new skills based immigration system to replace freedom of movement, and by protecting and enhancing our natural environment, we will make Britain a healthier place. title: why brexit made leave uk
story: NewsopinionWhy Brexit has made me leave the UK after seven yearsClaire Violette Herbaux fell in love with the UK when she moved from France and Germany seven years ago. But now, she writes, she feels like an outsiderShareCommentsByClaire Violette Herbaux:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsopinionClaire Violette Herbaux is leaving her beloved UK after seven years "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailToday is the day I am leaving the UK for good. My bags are packed, passport ready, boarding pass in my pocket and by the end of the day I will be back in Europe, and yes, it is because of Brexit. I wont go into a long political explanation, because the politics are only secondary. I am leaving because of the way le in the UK has changed for me since the vote. I moved to the UK seven years ago for university. Originally, it was only to study and I wasnt planning on staying. I just wanted to improve my English. But within the first six months I realised I loved the country. I loved the people and the fact that there is no formal and informal addresses for people, just you, I loved the fact that people call each other love, whether they know me or not. I loved le, and the language, and I even put up with the non mixer taps. This farewell article originally appeared on SomersetLive, where Claire Violette Herbaux had been working as a reporter.    Even though I only lived in the UK on and off after uni, I always planned on coming back. This is where I felt at home and where I was going to spend my le. But then I came back after the vote and things had changed. Now I hear people talk about foreigners and how they are waiting for March  for them to leave. Using the word Brexit in the conversation seems to have made it acceptable to say such things. This isnt a one-time occurrence. A sentence like this is uttered about once a week. Because I dont have a French or German accent , they dont realise they are talking about me.   And they are probably generalising and thinking of Eastern Europeans or even refugees, not me, but nevertheless I am part of this group of people they would prefer to leave their country. And this is what it boils down to. For the first time in my le, I am part of a group of people who are dferent and possibly dont belong. And let me tell you, it doesnt feel good. But there is of course also an element of uncertainty of how Brexit will unfold in  and how it will affect EU residents like me. I feel like I contribute in the same way as anyone  and I would want to be treated that way. Not a single day goes by without someone mentioning Brexit, the news reporting on it, or a meme showing up on Facebook.   Every time it does, it reminds me that the country I live in has decided to turn against everything I believe in. The EU isnt perfect, but I am proud to be European and I have grown up seeing the borders slowly disappear between countries and travel between my two homes in France and Germany becoming easier each year. No more numerous wallets for the currencies, no more stopping for border control. Every time I hear Brexit I remember the country is trying to distance itself from the this concept which I hold very dear. So while le is never perfect, I will go back to Europe. We have our own issues and politics to deal with, but at least I belong, I am a resident like any other, and I dont have to worry about my status changing because I am not a citizen. I will have the same rights as anybody  and enjoy the upsides of EU - which I have learned to appreciate even more since the Brexit talks began.

title: 12 most 2018 things happen
story: News of the most  things to happen in Theres no getting away from it -  has been a wild year of highs and lowsShareCommentsByTom DavidsonOnline Reporter:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsDo you remember the great Kentucky Fried Chicken drought of  "Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailEvery year has its defining moments, and  is no exception. A year that started with Baltic temperatures, also had one of the hottest summers on record. There was an England World Cup run that came so close, two Royal weddings, one royal baby, one royal pregnancy and, of course, the continued presence of Donald Trump. The US president even managed a visit to the UK this year - although he did his best to avoid the mass protests. Theres no denying  has been a year. These are the  most  stories of  - and theres not a single mention of Brexit. . YouTube star Logan Paul posted a video of a dead body at a Japanese forest infamous for suicides At the turn of the year Logan Paul was incredibly famous - on YouTube at least. But he soon became infamous. He was a superstar and regularly posted videos of himself, sort of, jerking around with his friends. But he made a huge misjudgement when he decided to film a video at Aokigahara by Mt. Fuji, also known as “suicide forest.” Paul and his friends stumbled upon a body of a man who had hanged himself, apparently just hours before, and proceeded to, sort of, jerk around.   The video got .m followers within  hours of uploading. Following a massive backlash Paul removed the video, wrote a written apology, then published a video apology. YouTube removed him from the Google preferred ad program... for all of a month before he was restored to his former glory.Later in the year he fought UK YouTube personality Olaajide JJ Olatunji, known as KSI, because OF COURSE HE DID. . We all survived the great KFC chicken shortage of  Cast your mind back to February of this year and you may remember the great KFC chicken shortage - which caused chaos for lovers of greasy fast food everywhere. The popular chain had changed their chicken supplier to DHL and QSL, but it ended in disaster. More than half of KFCs  UK outlets were forced to close after they ran out of chicken.  To put it simply,” KFC tweeted at the time, “we’ve got the chicken, we’ve got the restaurants, but we’ve just had issues getting them together. Well, their dedicated customers expected better. One irate fried-chicken-lover called  where they bemoaned having to go to Burger King. In early March, once the scandal had largely dropped out of the press, KFC rehired their original chicken suppliers Bidvest Logistics. Since then nation has been able to chow down on a Bargain Bucket whenever they so wish. . A Canadian skier at the Winter Olympics was arrested for allegedly stealing a red Hummer while drunk The Winter Olympics is Canadas thing. Thanks to their climate they are renowned for being damn good and collecting a whole stack of medals. Pity then Canadian skiier David Duncan whose Olympics ended on a sour note when he, along with his we and a ski coach called Willy Raine, was arrested on suspicion of stealing a red Hummer while drunk. Duncan was not the driver of the vehicle but nonetheless he was fined and the three of them were not allowed to participate in the closing ceremony.    All three apologised. We are deeply sorry, a statement by the Duncans read. We engaged in behaviour that demonstrated poor judgment and was not up to the standards expected of us as Members of the Canadian Olympic Team or as Canadians. . An American pastor spoke at the Royal Wedding and the Royal Family were shook Prince Harry wed Meghan Markle in a stunning ceremony at Windsor Castle in May of this year. It was a fairytale wedding and the ceremony included more than a nod to Meghans American and mixed-race heritage.  Bishop Michael Currys address, filled with the sort of fervour and energy not often associated with Royal weddings, left members of the royal family looking bemused while others laughed and nodded. He soon became an internet sensation. His wide-ranging and colourful speech was seen as a signicant break from tradition. He told the service: “There’s power in love. Love can help and heal when nothing  can. There’s power in love to lt up and liberate when nothing  will.”   He even referenced the African-American spiritual song Down by the Riverside, which was sung by slaves: When love is the way, we will lay down our swords and shields down by the riverside to study war no more. When love is the way, theres plenty good room, plenty good room for all of Gods children. Because when love is the way, we actually treat each other, well, like were actually family. Amen to that. . The UK got so unbearably hot we almost lost our sense of humour about it Oh lordy was it hot. We couldnt sleep. Colleagues were having deep conversations about whether to fork out an eye-watering amount of money for air conditioning. There was a nationwide run on fans.   The summer of  was the joint hottest on record for the UK and the hottest EVER for England. Day upon day of relentless heat in June and July meant we almost ran out of the memes required to express our discomfort at the decidedely un-British weather.  The hottest day of  so far was Thursday,  July, when temperatures reached .C in Faversham, Kent. Even Siri started taking the mick. . England beat Tunisia, Panama, Colombia and Sweden and everyone lost their minds A combination of outrageously high temperatures and a genuine World Cup run led to widespread craziness in much of England at the end of June and beginning of July. The Three Lions cast aside footballing giants Tunisia, Panama, Colombia and Sweden before bravely falling to Croatia in the semi-finals. But that extra time defeat has long vanished from the memories. Most footballing fans now only remember how Gareth Southgate suddenly became a fashion inspiration, Harry Kane was the best striker in the world and, of course, England finally won a penalty shootout.   Some people did take the excitement levels too far - footage of fans dancing on top of an ambulance in London Bridge was widely condemned. But on the whole it was a euphoric experience for a nation that has been jaded towards international football following years of chronic underachievement. . . Elon Musk baselessly called a cave er who helped save the lives of  people a pedo The world was united in joy in July when  members of a junior football team, and their coach, were rescued from Tham Luang cave following a huge international rescue operation. They had been trapped underground for  days but a treacherous and and risky plan to free them, involving some , people, was a success. So far, so normal.   But then billionaire Elon Musk got involved. Musk flew to Thailand and suggested the use of a sort-of mini submarine. Hero cave er Vernon Unsworth was not too impressed said it was a PR stunt and the tube had absolutely no chance of working. He told reporters: Musk can stick his submarine where it hurts.  The billionaire wasnt pleased and said that Unsworth was a pedo. After an initial apology and apparent retraction Musk then doubled-down on the baseless allegation. Unsworth is now suing Musk for , . . A chef called James Cochran got into a row with the restaurant where he once worked... called James Cochran James Cochran left James Cochran in early  - but not before the restaurant trademarked his name. Cochran, who has starred on BBCs Great British Menu and once had two Michelin stars, was not happy that the restaurant continued to trade with his name. On the eve of his BBC Two debut, Rayeula set up a website,jamescochran, which advertised the use of his name and recipes for pound a week to pubs and restaurants. In August he tweeted: “Anyone wanna buy me  My ex-employers are the lowest of low trying to sell off my name as recipes plans  !! Wtf   Who is going to pay pound a week just to add my name in front of the recipe   I will give you the recipes for freeyou’re that low!!”.  The owners of the James Cochran brand said they had trademarked his name long ago, before he left the company, and that it was well before he secured his appearance on the Great British Menu. Cochran is now head chef at his own restaurant,  in Islington. And hes changed his Twitter name to The Real James Cochran. James Cochranhasnt tweeted since August and the website is no longer active. . The one where a man who looked like Ross from Friends allegedly stole booze Lets not kid ourselves -  has been an intense year. So it was with unbridled glee the internet seized on the story of thethief in Blackpool who looked strikingly similar to Ross from Friends . The story quickly went viral and it was taken up another notch when Schwimmer himself spoofed the footage. Schwimmers tweet has been retweeted , times.    Perhaps owing to the huge publicity of the footage, a suspect, Abdulah Husseni was arrested and charged with stealing a crate of beer. Husseini is accused of stealing items includinga coat, a phone and a wallet from the Mr Basrai’s World Cuisines buffet restaurant in Blackpool. He failed to appear at a scheduled court appearance on December  and he is wanted by police once again. . A Banksy painted shredded itself seconds after being sold for poundm at Sothebys This was a story that not only shocked the art world but the wider world too. Kind of. Seconds after Banksys Girl With Red Balloon sold for poundm at Sothebys auction house the work partially shredded itself. People were stunned and analysts fell over themselves trying to guess what Banksy meant by his daring act. Was it a statement on the value of art in high society  Was it a damning rebuke of empty consumerism  Or was he simply trolling the art world    Regardless, the purchaser of the paintingwas still laughing. The stunt helped increase the estimated value of the work, renamed Love Is In The Bin, to at least pound.m. A jubilant Sothebys released a statement that called it the first artwork in history to have been created live during an auction . Bungling Russian spies were caught trying to launch a cyber attack on a weapons watchdog Four smartly dressed Russians who arrived in the Netherlands trying to pass themselves off as tourists, were, of course nothing of the sort. They were undercover officers working for GRU, Russias biggest and most powerful spy agency. They were on a mission to try and hack in to the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons . But their GRU training must have skipped over some of the important lessons for covert spies. British intelligence knew of their April plot in advance and tipped off their Dutch colleagues. When counter-espionage officials felt they had enough evidence they swooped on the four and found fairly damning evidence of an attempted cyber attack. In the car boot was a G smartphone, a transformer, a battery bag and a WiFi  antenna. Oh but theres more. In the car was €, and , in crisp hundred denomination bills. And on their phones were even photos of taxi receipts one of the men had used to get from GRU HQ to the airport where they flew to Amsterdam. James Bond, they aint. . Witches complained about Donald Trump calling the Mueller investigation a witch hunt The ongoing soap opera that is the Trump White House means this entire list could have been made of stories surrounding the US President. But our pick is a late entry from December - when witches complained about Donald Trump repeatedly calling the Mueller investigation into possible collusion with Russia a WITCH HUNT . Robert S. Muellers wide-ranging probe continued to create headaches for the bouffant-haired President. He could not resist repeatedly taking to Twitter to label it a witch hunt, while also decrying the lack of federal investigations into his political opponent from  Hillary Clinton. By December the witches of the United States had had enough.   For those who practice witchcraft, the president’s words bring up a painful period in history, when men and women were accused of being witches and murdered, both in the American colonies and in Europe. Kitty Randall, who uses the name “Amber K.” in the witching world, calls the period a “traumatic emotional imprint” on modern-day witches. She told The Daily Beast: To have him compare his situation to the worst period in our history is just infuriating.

title: big 2019 mirrors essential guide
story: NewsBig in : Mirrors essential guide to the best things coming in the New YearWhat will the hottest trends of  be  We ask the experts hereShareCommentsByMirror:,  DEC NewsWill Cheryl make a comeback  "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWant to know what the latest trends are for   Our experts in every field from showbiz, sport and tech to travel, music and motoring will fill you in:   Showbiz, by Tom Bryant People have been writing off Cheryl for years but she still manages to retain her place in the spotlight. But  really does feel a make or break year for the former Mrs Cole. With her music career floundering – at least when it came to the lowly chart position of her latest single – all eyes are on her as she lines up as a judge on The Greatest Dancer on the BBC. It’s ato primetime doubtless accompanied by a big pay day. But will it be enough to revitalise her somewhat mixed career to date in the eyes of the British public  One person whose legacy is assured is Nashville legend Dolly Parton and the UK will be hearing a lot more of her this year – as her new musical  to  opens in London’s West End.   And will  be the year that Katie Price’s career finally implodes and we can all stop thinking about her  It’s been teetering on the edge for some time with bankruptcy woes and both drug and marriage dramas. She has always pulled it back from the brink with another big payday, be it a TV gig or a new book deal. But has the public fallen out of love with her  We’ll find out in the next  months.  Irish crowds welcome  with a bang as Dublin delivers spectacular New Years Eve firework display Travel, by Nigel Thompson Marvellous news! The Marvellous City will be a low-cost flight away from March. Norwegian airline will fly its jetlag-busting Dreamliners to Brazil’s sensational Rio de Janeiro from Gatwick starting at pound one way. And that seriously challenges British Airways monopoly on the route – great for travellers. Talking of BA, they also have a cracking new Heathrow service – to Charleston, South Carolina, from April. This easy-going, charming, foodie-friendly, warm weather Southern gem will open up the region from pound .   I also like the look of TUI’s new Mexican hotspot for next winter. Los Cabos, on the Pacic coast Baja Calornia peninsula, attracts the likes of Nicole Kidman and George Clooney and flights start from Gatwick in November. Cruising is booming and the ship to be on is the incredible new Celebrity Edge, which will be sailing the Med next summer. Among many innovations, the standout is the Magic Carpet deck which moves up and down the ship. The B word can’t be avoided and Brexit will loom large, with a weak pound meaning Brits will seek value in non-euro destinations such as Turkey, Bulgaria, Tunisia and Egypt. And staycations will stay popular – expect Northumberland and Scotland to have a good year.   Technology, by Shivali Best It was one of the biggest smartphone trends for , but the “notch” could be a thing of the past in . Notches feature on many smartphone screens but have ided users, with many claiming they’re unsightly and distracting. But fear not, notch-haters, we could wave goodbye to the feature this coming year. Both Honor and Samsung have confirmed their  smartphones will instead feature a “display hole” – a cutout area in the screen that houses the front-facing camera instead of a notch. Aside from smartphones themselves, the big tech trend for  is bound to be G. EE will roll out the technology in  locations across the UK in , including London, Cardf, Edinburgh, Belfast, Birmingham and Manchester. Day to day, G will mean downloading and streaming films and games will be signicantly faster – and you can wave goodbye to the dreaded buffering. To get on board you’ll probably need a new phone which is G capable.   Music, by Martin Gavin Theof Madonna, an endlessly influential pop-culture giant, is bound to create a stir in . Madge’s comeback has been teased through her social media. But to reclaim her Queen of Pop crown from the likes of Beyonce and Lady Gaga, she can’t afford any Brit Awards-style slip-ups. Ready to spice up their pension plans, the Spice Girls finally make a fully fledged reunion, minus Victoria Beckham. But will they spoil it by releasing inferior new material  Stormzy’s Glastonbury headline slot has already caused predictable complaint from trad indie fans, but it will be the crowning of a star for a new generation. The Eaglesto clock up more dates on a never-ending farewell tour. On the th anniversary year of their  masterpiece Let It Bleed, The Rolling Stones pose the eternal “is this the last time ’” question with shows in the USA. Chances that they won’t circle back and take their bow on a home stage, too  Smaller than Mick Jagger’s waistband. Bob Dylan and Neil Young are on the same bill in London’s Hyde Park and Bruce Springsteen is due to release an album.   Sport, by Andy Dunn Keep an eye out for teenage prodigies Jack Draper and Max Burgin, great British hopes in tennis and middle-distance running. The -year-old and -year-old are two for the long-term but  should be a big year for golfer Georgia Hall, , the British Open champion who will have her sights set on the world No spot. In football, Jadon Sancho, , has taken the Bundesliga by storm, so expect him to make his mark for England in the UEFA Nations League finals in Portugal in June. But cricket’s World Cup – from the end of May to mid-July – should reignite the spirit of last summer as a brilliant England side, starring Joe Root, start as favourites.   Soaps, by Sara Wallis On the cobbles, Peter and Carla are drawn back together, but there’s a shock for Audrey when she realises that her inheritance is missing. Meanwhile, Sophie and Tim plot to get Sally out of prison. And Corrie bosses have teased that Kate Connor and Rana Nazir, nicknamed Kana, could reunite. In Emmerdale, villagers had better watch out as Paddy’s fiery ex Mandy Dingle, played by Lisa Riley, s after  years. She’s bound to set the cat among the pigeons. Meanwhile, over in EastEnders, watch out for theof Loftyand Mary “The Punk” , who are set to come back to the Square for a funeral, after an absence of three decades.   Fashion, by Amber Graafland Prepare to embrace neo-tailoringcoloured leather, artisan craft details, gigantic sorbet coloured ruffles and a sea of beige. The good news is it’s time to say goodbye to ugly trainers – the bad being that orthopaedic-style sandals are very much in vogue. And as the fashion industry prepares to turn its back on gender in the era of #MeToo it’s all about unisex dressing. On the must-have accessory front the bum bag still looks set to be big. But the new bad boy in town is the full size garment bag as seen on the runway at Gucci and Alexander Wang. Convinced  Nor are we. Books, by Julie McCaffery February brings the launch of Tom Bower’s book Jeremy Corbyn, which promises sharp insight into the Labour Party leader. Previous subjects include Tony Blair. Frankissstein by Jeanette Winterson brings Frankenstein’s story frighteningly up to date in May. In the same month comes Silence of the Lambs writer Thomas Harris’ first book in  years. David Nicholls has the rare gt of making readers cry, laugh out loud and gasp. The One Day author’s next book, Sweet Sorrow, is out in July. Apple Tree Yard author Louise Doughty’s crime thriller Platform Seven is released in August. September brings Margaret Atwood’s The Testaments, the sequel to The Handmaid’s Tale. The memoirs of Elton John and Bake Off star Nadiya Hussain follow in October.   Motoring, by Colin Goodwin Plenty of new cars are coming our way in . If you’ve just won the lottery we might be able to interest you in the Ferrari Pista Spider with a top speed of mph and race car handling. Be prepared to write a cheque for around pound,. For the rest of us some oldmotors are being replaced. Vauxhall will have a new Astra and Corsa and VW a totally new Golf that’ll be the eighth generation car since ’s Mk. Toyota is reintroducing the Corolla name to the UK with a new hatchback. It looks quite promising in photos. We’ll be testing all of them, of course. More new crossovers and SUVs are on their way and many of them will have hybrid powertrains. Expect to see a few new electric cars on the road, too. We’re still a long way from an electric revolution but hopefully more charging points will sprout up in . Back in  I proudly predicted that Lewis Hamilton would be that year’s F champion. story: NewsChildless couples given hope the postcode lottery for free IVF will end this yearLabour MP Steve McCabe is pushing through legislation to bring the injustice to an endShareCommentsByJeremy Armstrong:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC News"Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailChildless couples have been given hope the postcode shylottery for free IVF will end this year. MPs are set to consider a law to make access to treatment fairer. Emma Edey, , denied IVF, said: “I am praying it goes through quickly.” Campaigners have branded it a disgrace that the so-called cruel postcode shylottery denies would-be parents the chance to have a child – unless they can afford private IVF. Currently only three local health authorities in England offer childless couples the recommended three free cycles of IVF, while many provide only one or none at all. But there is hope, as Labour MP Steve McCabe is pushing through legislation to bring the injustice to an end. Mr McCabe believes his private member’s bill, set for its second reading on January , could be passed into law by this time next year. He said: “Infertility is a medical shycondition and it is time we started treating it like one. It is simply unfair that access to IVF is down to where you live and not your medical need.” The Birmingham Selly Oak MP’s bill aims to get fairer access to treatment for any childless couple and would set a minimum number of IVF cycles.   He said he has cross-party support and added: “I will be doing everything in my power to make sure the postcode lottery for IVF is brought to an end.” Government is under pressure to act after the Fertility Network charity persuaded , people to sign an online petition in just  weeks. Chief executive Aileen Feeney said: “Childlessness affects one in six couples. That’s someone in every street. If you can’t get free treatment on the NHS and currently that depends completely on where you live, then only those wealthy enough to pay for IVF privately can hope to have a child. That’s disgraceful.” Aileen spent two weeks this summer cycling , miles from Land’s End to John O’Groats, raising pound, for her charity’s campaign. She will deliver the petition to PM Theresa May.   Health watchdog the National Institute of Health and Care Excellence recommends any woman under  should be given three full cycles of IVF, or one full cycle for those aged  to . Women who have three cycles increase their chances of having a baby to better than %. But just three of  clinical commissioning groups offer the three cycles – all in Greater Manchester. Seven offer none. Some break NICE guidelines by setting their own access rules – including reducing the age limit. Yet in Scotland any woman under  can have three full IVF cycles. In Wales women are entitled to two and in Northern Ireland those under  get one partial cycle of IVF. Those denied free IVF face having to find pound, a time for each round of treatment. Lib Dem leader Sir Vince Cable said: “It’s wrong there is so little support and , backing this campaign shows the strength of feeling behind the call for change. Liberal Democrats are listening and ministers in Whitehall must listen too.” Its completely unfair Two couples from the same town demonstrate the appalling injustice of the IVF postcode lottery. Emma and Lee Edey, , married in  and were about to start IVF in  when their local CCG decided to pull the funding. Emma, , appealed against the decision, and was granted treatment only for it to be withdrawn. The Edeys await the verdict of the North East Essex CCG before Jan  to seetheir first cycle of IVF will be granted. Rachel and Tom Hinsbey also live in Colchester, Essex, but began their IVF treatment six years ago when they lived in Chelmsford - under Mid Essex CCG. They were granted the funding for a first round of treatment which saw the birth of their daughter Amalie on March , . They have since moved to Colchester and elected to use embryos frozen at the time of the first cycle of treatment to try again for another child.   The NHS funding for IVF had been withdrawn, so they paid privately at the Bourn clinic in Colchester - at a greatly reduced cost of pound. Twins Margot and Teddy were born three months ago, to make their family complete. Meanwhile a desperate Emma, who has a bowel condition but is ready for IVF, said: “We applied for exceptional circumstances, that was granted last May. “Then my hormonal levels were too high so I am back to the CCG  to seeI can go ahead with IVF. It is all to do with the egg quality. If I could afford to pay privately, I could have it tomorrow, but we do not have that kind of money.” Costs y, but could be up to pound,. North east Essex is one of the areas in England where all NHS IVF treatment has been removed or suspended. Emma described it as ‘completely unfair’ to offer IVF in one area, but not in another. “It is so frustrating to keep me waiting. “The last three years has been hell,” she added. “I am praying the law goes through Parliament quickly. None of us is any younger. I could have a three-year-old child now. Instead I am full of anger.” Rachel and engineer Tom Hinsbey, , tried for  months after their marriage to start a family before discovering Tom did not have a tube which carries sperm. They were then referred for NHS-funded IVF treatment. Rachel, , a former medical writer who now makes baby clothes, said: “The IVF funding was withdrawn six months after Amalie was born.   “We started again this time last year and we have just had twins but paid privately for the treatment ourselves. “Amalie was born in , where they inject the sperm directly into the egg which increases the chance of success. “Margot and Teddy were born three months ago using the embryos left over from Amalie’s treatment, it was cheaper for us because we stored them. “It came to about pound including treatment and drugs but that is way cheaper than it would have been otherwise. “The system is just crazy now. it is completely unfair, funding went from three frozen plus three fresh cycles in Essex to nothing. “Even London is better, Essex is now the worst place for any kind of fertility treatment. “IVF is seen as non essential and is the first thing to get axed. “But it has massive consequences for your health, physically and mentally, when you struggle to conceive. You feel as a woman that you are unable to do what you should be able to do. “Getting the specic reason something was wrong was so important - we at least knew what to do. Others are left in limbo without any explanation. That is just horrible.”

title: mums life saved simple cup
story: NewsMums le saved by simple cup of tea after she felt tumour while reaching for brewTea fan Nicola Fairbrass credits her nightly cuppa for saving her le as she found her lump while reaching for the drinkShareCommentsByAliki KraterouKelly-Ann Mills:,  DEC NewsShe needed chemotherapy to beat the breast cancer "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA mums le was saved by a cup of tea after she discovered a tumour when she reached for her evening brew. Nicola Fairbrass decided to take a cuppa to bed with her in November last year, but as she turned around to grab it from her bedside table, she felt a lump in her left breast. The married mum-of-one went to her doctor two weeks later and in December last year the -year-old was diagnosed with stage three breast cancer. Luckily, after a year of intensive treatment dog sitter Nicola, from Oakwood, Derby, is now cancer free - and credits the cup of tea with saving her le. Nicola, who drinks five cups day said: We take a cup of tea to bed most nights - tea is my preference. That night I turned around to get my cup of tea from the bedside table but as I was pulling it towards me, I felt a lump in my left breast.  I left it for about two weeks, thinking it might just be a cyst or something . But then it became bigger again, and when I went to the doctor they referred me straight to the hospital. I love tea and I think, in a way, it saved my le. Nicola, who had just taken over a brand new dog-sitting business, had a mammogram, ultrasound and biopsy before she was diagnosed. While initially she was told she would need a mastectomy, her doctor suggested she tried chemotherapy first. Nicola underwent a lymph node surgery in January this year to make sure the cancer wasnt spreading, and then needed eight rounds of gruelling chemotherapy for six months. But luckily the treatment worked, and the lump was reduced in size from  millimetres to  millimetres.  In August this year, Nicola had a lumpectomy and  sessions of radiotherapy to kill any cancerous cells which might have been left. Two weeks later, in September, she was declared cancer free although she must take medication for the next five to  years. Nichola said she couldnt have made it without the support of her daughter Gabrielle,  and her husband Paul, . She said: Waiting for the results was the worst, it was horrendous. I tried to carry on as best as I could because it was holiday time. My daughter was affected, she had a really hard time - but she kept being strong for me. My husband had to take time off work to help at home because I was basically housebound. But I cant moan, everyone around me has been very supportive. It has been a huge relief to get the all clear and finish treatment and just be able to get on with my le again, as my le was just on hold for the past year. It has been a very tough year, but I am glad it is over.  During her illness, Nicola had to assign her dog-sitting business, Barking Mad, to someone , but is now excited to get back to doing what she loves. She added: My adviceyou feel a lump would be get straight to the doctors, dont delay. I dont think people check themselves enough, so I want to raise awareness.

The unnamed employee was reportedly fired by state broadcaster IRIB after the scene slipped through the countrys tight censorship rules. Viewers on Kish Island are said to have been shocked by the clip showing martial arts star Chan having sex with a prostitute in a film.The scene, from Shinjuku Incident, was aired in a country where men and women are not even permitted to shake hands on screen. It is even claimed that censors are ordered to remove the exchange of tender words or jokes by men and women, the BBC reports.  Local media said the scene was shown in total violation of IRIBs regulations, prompting the dismissal and reprimand of employees.As well as the head of the regional TV channel, other staff members are reported to have been axed following the incident.Video footage of the broadcast - which was shared online, apparently by a viewer on Kish Island - sparked a quick response. The semi-official ISNA news agency reported: Clips of immoral scenes of a film featuring Jackie Chan have been circulating on social media which was apparently shown by Kish IRIB. “These scenes which are in total contradiction with the principles of IRIB has ultimately led to the dismissal and reprimand of some of the employees of IRIB in Kish.  This included IRIB’s director-general for Kish, AFP reports. An investigation was reportedly launched into the incident, but some Iranians hit out at the broadcasters response online.Some pointed out that no one had been fired over a horror bus crash that killed  students at Tehran’s Azad University last week. “Buses turn over, planes crash, ships sink… no one is dismissed… A few seconds of Jackie Chan making love on IRIB and immediately all staff in that section are sacked,” one Twitter user wrote.

title: jamal khashoggi cctv shows butchered
story: NewsJamal Khashoggi: CCTV shows butchered journalists body parts being carried in bagsThe harrowing footage shows men carrying black bags and suitcases into the Saudi consul generals residence in Istanbul, TurkeyShareCommentsBySophie EvansOrhan Coskun:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video jamal-khashoggis-body-parts-carried-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:,],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailDisturbing footage purportedly showing murdered Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggis body parts being carried in bags has emerged. In the CCTV men can be seen carrying black bags and suitcases into the home of the Saudi consul general in Istanbul, Turkey. Dressed in normal clothes, the males bring in the luggage - allegedly containing the butchered journalists remains - one after another. The residence is a short distance from the consulate where Mr Khashoggi, a leading critic of Saudi policies, was killed in early October. Reports have claimed he was murdered and cut into pieces. Last month, Turkeys Foreign Minister said the -year-old was killed within seven minutes in a premeditated murder recorded on tape.  Mevlut Cavusoglu said he had listened to the disgusting clip - which captured a forensic experts enjoyment as he cut up Mr Khashoggi. He told Germanys Sueddeutsche Zeitung newspaper: It can be heard how the forensics expert instructs the others: they should listen to music while he cuts up the body. One notices how he enjoys it. The footage showing a number of bags being carried into the Saudi consul generals residence - allegedly on the day of the murder two months ago - was broadcast by a Turkish pro-government TV channel. The channel A Haber reported that a total of five cases were apparently taken through the main entrance of the residence by the men.  A Turkish official said the media report, also carried by the pro-government Sabah newspaper on its website, appeared to be accurate. However, they did not give further details. According to Sabah, the cases had been brought to the residence in a black minibus at : pm . There was no immediate reply from Saudi authorities to a Reuters request for comment on the footage. Mr Khashoggi was a royal insider who became a critic of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. He began writing for the Washington Post after moving to the United States last year.  Saudi officials have rejected accusations that the crown prince ordered his death. His murder has sparked global outrage and damaged the international reputation of the -year-old prince, the kingdoms de facto leader. After offering numerous contradictory explanations regarding the fate of Mr Khashoggi, Riyadh said he had been killed and his body dismembered when negotiations to persuade him toto Saudi Arabia failed. The journalists remains have not been found and Turkey has repeatedly asked Saudi Arabia where they are.  Last month, Turkish police searched a remote villa in a coastal area southeast of Istanbul as part of the investigation. Saudi Arabias public prosecutors office said last month it is seeking the death penalty for five iniduals. It added that  of  suspects have been indicted and will be referred to court in Saudi Arabia. Mr Cavusoglu said last week Ankara was working with other countries to take the investigation into Mr Khashoggis killing to the United Nations.

story: NewsPregnant girl, , who went missing on Christmas Day found safe and wellZoe Hitchcock, , has been missing from her home in Dublin, Ireland, since Christmas Day and failed to attend a hospital appointmentShareCommentsByElaine McCahillNews Reporter:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsMissing pregnant teen Zoe Hitchcock has been found safe and well"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA missing pregnant teenager has been found safe and well after being last seen on Christmas Day. Zoe Hitchcock, , from Dublin city centre, is seven months pregnant and went missing from her home on December th. She failed to attend an appointment at the Coombe hospital earlier today. Officials had been concerned for her welfare and issued an appeal for information relating to her whereabouts. A garda spokesman said at the time: Zoe is currently seven months pregnant and she failed to attend the Coombe Hospital this morning st December for a scheduled appointment and gardai are concerned for her welfare.  She was last seen in the Dublin City area and is known to frequent the Tallaght area. Zoe is ft , medium build, with fair hair dyed blonde, blue eyes. She was wearing a long-sleeved black and white top, pink and white fur body warmer, black dress and pink boots when last seen. Gardai released a statement saying Zoe had been found and thanked the public for their help. A spokesperson added: Zoe Hitchcock, , has been located safe and well. Thank you for your assistance.

title: dundee people multi sensory penguin hunt show has children all a flutter with excitement
story: Local little ones had a fantastic time helping to find Philip the penguin at an interactive theatre performance.Kids aged two to six headed to Dundee Rep to take part in the Flutter performance which took them on a journey through a world of winter snow.The show combined puppetry, music and dferent materials to create a multi-sensory show for small hands, eyes, ears and noses.The young ones were treated to a snowy performance by Christie Mitchell and Arran Howie before they were invited on to the stage to meet Philip the penguin and play in the snow with the actresses.Christie said: “Early years audiences are probably the greatest and most honest audiences to perform in front of.“They get so involved throughout the show, shouting out funny one- liners, and by the end they are itching to get up on the set to play with the snow and meet Philip the penguin.“It is fantastic when parents come up to us at the end and say ‘my -month-old child has just sat for  minutes without losing concentration – it’s a miracle’.“It is nice to be told you are so captivating.”Amanda Cherry, from Perth, took her three-year-old daughter Ella to the performance and thought it was great to see something a bit dferent.She said: “I didn’t know what to expect but the two actresses were really good.“It was great to take Ella to see something a bit dferent that she could get involved in.”Broughty Ferry mum Victoria Spendf took along four-year-old twins Brody and Elliot and thinks it is important to get kids into theatre from a young age.She added: “We all absolutely loved the show. It was lovely to see the boys so engaged and joining in with the performance.“I would definitely recommend parents to come along to shows like this as I think it is very important to introduce your children to the arts as early as possible.”Linda Murray also enjoyed the show with three-year-old Arran but the trip may have become a bit more expensive for her.She said: “It was fantastic, Arran really enjoyed it. It is definitely his cup of tea getting to go up on stage and get interaction from the performers. However, now I have to go out and buy him his very own Philip the penguin.”

title: dundee v st johnstone ending year with a victory is paramount for dark blues
story: Paul McGowan says it’s “paramount” Dundee finish off a miserable  with a victory as they welcome St Johnstone to Dens Park today.The winter break beckons after the final whistle and the Dark Blues midfielder wants to be heading into the time off by ending on a positive note.And,results where go their way, that could see them off the bottom of the Premiership table going into the second half of the campaign.The Perth Saints, however, have been in mean form of late – winning seven of their last  and keeping eight clean sheets in the process.Dundee’s home form makes good reading, too, though, and ‘Gowser’ has called on a repeat performance of the battling - draw against Livingston on Wednesday.He accepts, however, they’ll need to provide better service to the strikersthey are to get the win they crave.He told the Tele: “We want to finish with a win, it’s paramount we finish the year with a victory.“Going into a week or so off with a win will do our confidence no harm at all.“It will be a tough game and we will need to battle like we did on Wednesday to get anything from it.“That’s us four unbeaten going into another tough game against St Johnstone.“I feelwe play like we did on Wednesday, starting with a clean sheet is always the way forward andwe can start scoring goals again we’ll win games.“Our end ball, though, has to be better into the strikers. We need to give them something to prey on.“We’re getting into good areas out wide but the final ball is either too much or not beating the first man.#He added: #We know what we will get from St Johnstone, it will be another tough game, like Livingston.“I just hope we have turned a corner now.“I felt we looked solid, we worked for each other, filling in for each other and it was enjoyable to play in that game.“The three before Wednesday weren’t great but that was back to our old selves.”In the past three seasons, it’s been all level in the battles between the top-flight’s Tayside teams with four wins apiece in the last eight.And the -year-old expects yet another close encounter.He said: “It’s been mixed against St Johnstone for us lately.“Tommy Wright’s brought in some good players and they are doing well this season.“Nearly every season you say that – you think they are going to hit a blip but they just don’t.“They can grind out results but they’ve been playing good football as well and can mix it up.“It will be tough and we need to be at it.”After defeats to Kilmarnock, Aberdeen and Celtic, McGowan feels the point against Livingston on Boxing Day is a step back in the right direction.“We earned a clean sheet from a tough game – Livi kept launching balls and we had to stand up and be counted,” he said.“I felt we did that well but we lacked the cutting edge, the final ball when getting into good areas. It’s a step back in the right direction and, hopefully, be a good point in the end.“Livingston’s gameplan was to go direct and put balls into the box to make things hard for us but I felt we stood up to it very well, I can’t think of them having a clear chance.“A draw was probably a fair result but I felt we were the better team.Hopefully, it’s a good point come the end of the season.”
